name: Hard Rock Hotel Vallarta

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The service was absolutely excellent as well as our accomodations. Loved the champagne upon arrival, friendly staff, no time share pressure, and quickly shown to our room. We had a first floor room which was great because the doors opened steps away from the pool. Perfect if you have children. Everything was so clean and the food was great for an all inclusive. There were cocktail waitresses walking around the pool constantly asking if we would like a drink and the drinks are brought quickly. We highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Amazing resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aventura Palace for our honeymoon about 7 years ago, and we loved that resort so we thought we would try another Palace resort for a quick week get away.
reviews.title: Disappointed with this Palace

likes.disliked: — There are almost no rooms with balconies and housekeeping keeps forgetting to lock patio doors if you are on the ground floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is definitely not couple friendly! If you are travelling with a family, friends, or there on a conference then this is the place for you. Otherwise, if you are looking for a romantic and quiet getaway, do not stay here.
reviews.title: Perfect for us!

likes.liked: — Upscale feel and no need for reservations @ dinner!

reviews.text: We ended up transfering to another resort halfway through the week and that was the best decision that we made.
reviews.title: All inclusive thats like a 4 Seasons Hotel

likes.liked: — The Staff, the food, the entire complex

reviews.title: fabulous place to go
reviews.text: We stayed at the Vallarta Palace April 3-7 to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and loved it! The resort is large, but everything is very centrally located -- no real walking to get anywhere. They have 4 restaurants - 1 buffet type and 3 themed (order from menu in the evenings) - but no reservations needed for any of them (really liked that as vacations should be easy). Food was very good , and they serve wine from Chile and higher-end liquor (my hubby was stuck choosing from Chivas or Johnny Walker Black -oh darn!). Really liked Mar Intimo restaurant (Italian in the evenings) as it was ocean side and had beautiful views of the beach and bay (great for sunsets!).

reviews.title: Great vacation!
reviews.text: Wow! All I can say is, take the negative reviews with a heaping tablespoon of salt. If you haven't spent a lot of time in Mexico, it may take some getting used to. It's just different than the US, different language, different culture, different customs. As with many places, high end and low end, your attitude definitely influences the service you receive and I wonder if that might not be reason for some of the negative experiences. It is true that many places in Mexico (and elsewhere) that are 5-star are not necessarily what you would consider a 5-star say in NYC, London, or Paris. Doesn't mean they're not nice places to stay! You can also get bad maids and bad food in any of those places too. Ok, enough of the soapbox.

Our stay was great. We found the hotel staff to be courteous and responsive, the rooms to be clean (and cleaned regularly) and comfortable, and the food, if not always gourmet, to be fresh and enjoyable. The pools and beach were clean and there were always activities going on, but they weren't pushy about joining them (as with some competitors of this particular resort). The Mar Intimo breakfast and lunch buffet was terriffic, and don't miss the flaming mexican coffee at La Fiesta! The menu at MoMoNoHana isn't the most inspired or varied compared even to the corner chinese restaurant (every dish was teriyaki or noodle-based), but it certainly wasn't inedible or gross. The sushi appetizer was very good and the egg rolls were some of the best I've ever had.
reviews.title: Amazing place!

likes.liked: — Service and not having to make reservations at the restaurants for dinner.

reviews.text: We never had a problem getting drink service at the pool, and all of the staff were friendly and gave great service. I also went to the spa the last day we were there and had a heavenly massage.
reviews.title: Take advantage of the Free Tours

likes.disliked: — The hard rain at night, but it's done before morning.

reviews.text: I do think the hotel could do a few things better to keep up with their competition.
reviews.title: Wonderful place and tips on navigating the airport!

likes.liked: — All-inclusive, great beach, sunny and warm, friendly staff, clean hotel, good food, beautiful landscaping and setting.
likes.disliked: — Two of the eight of us got

reviews.text: *bracelets. I can see why this would be necessary given that the hotel is in the middle of town and the beach is open access from neighboring hotels. But really, bracelets are tacky and I always feel like a spring-breaker when I have to wear one, especially at a nice hotel like this. There must be a better way to keep track - maybe swipe your room key?
reviews.title: Fabulous Family fun!

likes.liked: — The amenities and the in room jacuzzi

reviews.text: We were at the resort March 18 - 24. Even though it was completely full for Spring Break, the service was excellent, the grounds were immaculate and we loved our stay!
reviews.title: Great resort - loved our stay

reviews.text: The beach is wonderful! Soft sand, waves crashing in, boogie boards and sea kayaks to use at your leisure. There are two sets of palm covered beach huts. The ones to the right of the activities desk are quieter and only steps away from the Triton bar, snack area and restrooms. We had steady service every day we were out there. The activities pool can get a little loud in the afternoon, but the kids loved it. If you want quiet, come to the beach or use the pool by Mar Imito (the Italian restaurant).
reviews.title: Great place to relax

likes.liked: — comfortable beds and rooms, great view from the rooms

reviews.text: Food usually isn't the centerpiece at an all-inclusive, but we thought the staff did a great job here as well. No one came home skinner than they left!
reviews.title: Amazing and Relaxing Vacation!

likes.liked: — Resort was upscale and large, but had an intimate feel. Loved the excellent service.

reviews.text: Breakfast couldn't be better -- eggs, omlets, crepes cooked to order; huge selection of fruits, fresh waffles and french toast. (Be sure to look for the hot cocoa in the hot foods area near the oatmeal. Yummy.) The breakfast usuals were there each morning plus new choices daily. Two cooks (inside and outside) meant very little wait even during peak times at a packed resort.
reviews.title: It's a pleasure !!!

likes.disliked: — The lack of a little more nightlife

reviews.text: Lunch at Mar Imito was also great. A chef made fresh stir fry from the ingredients you assembled or you could choose from a buffet with everything from sandwiches and salads to grilled fish. Pasta and hamburgers were also made to order.
reviews.title: Five Star Resort - One Star Food

likes.disliked: — Food was just horrible. I can't stress enough how bad the food was.

reviews.text: The hotel grounds are beautiful but stark and modern. Plenty of pool and beach chairs. Service around pool after 10 am is good. Appreciated the heated pool, ocean and breeze were chilly.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.text: Not really impressed with the food. You do have to get creative. The Triton snack bar buffet was just bad. The "cheese" doesn't even melt on your burger. The lunch at the Italin food (Mar Intimo) is the best. The chips and gucamole were good here too. We also enjoyed our dinner there as well. Desserts were the best here. Also, preferred the superior service here as well. Plus, I like to eat with a view of the ocean! Sushi is good at the Japanese place (Momo No Hana) but don't order anything else. Breakfast at Bugambilieas was good, we did not eat there for dinner because our group had two Mexican buffets. Room service breakfast was not great. We did go to La Fiesta for dinner which is Brazilian style kabobs. My beef was raw when they served it, I asked for it to be cooked a little more, just a little pink. Of course they cooked over well done!
reviews.title: Spring Break_2008

reviews.text: Our room was good size with two double beds, but they could take the large jacuzzi out of the room and put in two queens! The jacuzzi is just silly! Way to big! You could put 4 people in it. But, you would never have enough hot water to fill it! We didn't even touch the free booze in the room. Our refrigerator didn't even work. We called to have it fixed, it worked or cooled for one day and then it didn't work again. Our shower would not drain, we asked this to be fixed. They did not fix it the first time we asked. I had to go to the lobby and re-request it. The rooms are very noisy. You can hear everyone walkiing up and down the tile halls. We did request an upper floor room, hoping from the other reviews it would be quietier, but it wasn't. Our balcony door would not shut all the way, so we heard all the out door noise. Luckily, things usually quieted down by midnight. The balconies are non-exsistant. This is really ashame since the views are so nice. Maid service was good, we had a clean room and towels everyday. Don't eat the pillow chocolates, they are really bad! My daughter spit it out!
reviews.title: Vallarta Palace Was Wonderful

reviews.text: Basically this resort just has lots of small glitches that keeps it from being a first class place. Unfortunately, they just keep adding up until you think I don't want to come back here. Move away from the pool by noon unless you like the activity director and music blasted in your ears. The beach is quieter.
reviews.title: Wonderful All-Inclusive Resort

likes.liked: — Beach was not crowded, beautiful, alot of activities to do. Rooms have great ocean view!
likes.disliked: — Large double jacuzzi in the rooms take up too much space.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel gift shop was nice and reasonably priced, I bought more soveniors here than downtown PV.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation

description: Hard Rock Hotel Vallarta is a gorgeous, 348-room beachfront property ideally situated between mountains and the Pacific Ocean, featuring unmatched, all-inclusive luxury accommodations including in-room double Jacuzzis, fine dining, top-shelf drinks, 24-hour room service, live entertainment and more. One of only three AAA Four-Diamond hotels in the area, this stylish property boasts six restaurants offering tantalizing specialty cuisines, four bars and lounges with top shelf drinks, two large outdoor swimming pools, children’s pool, beach volleyball court, tennis court, Body Rock Fitness Center, unmatched music memorabilia, signature Rock Spa®, a Rock Shop and much more. The property additionally features 6,300 square feet of meeting facilities.
